definitions.definition: A small pack or package ; a little bundle or parcel
examples: Don't throw the crisp packet on the floor!

definitions.definition: Originally, a vessel employed by government to convey dispatches or mails; hence, a vessel employed in conveying dispatches, mails, passengers, and goods, and having fixed days of sailing; a mail boat. Packet boat, ship, vessel ( Wikipedia ).
A specimen envelope containing small, dried plants or containing parts of plants when attached to a larger sheet.
A small fragment of data as transmitted on some types of network , notably Ethernet networks ( Wikipedia ).
A protocol data unit of the Internet Protocol .
A message sent over a transport layer protocol .

examples: It'll cost a packet to fix this.

main_definition: A small pack or package ; a little bundle or parcel
secondary_definitions: ( nautical ) Originally, a vessel employed by government to convey dispatches or mails; hence, a vessel employed in conveying dispatches, mails, passengers, and goods, and having fixed days of sailing; a mail boat. Packet boat, ship, vessel ( Wikipedia ).
( botany ) A specimen envelope containing small, dried plants or containing parts of plants when attached to a larger sheet.
( networking ) A small fragment of data as transmitted on some types of network , notably Ethernet networks ( Wikipedia ).
( networking ) A protocol data unit of the Internet Protocol .
( networking ) A message sent over a transport layer protocol .
( slang ) Synonym of package ( “ male genitalia ” ) .
( informal ) A large amount of money.
